На тему этой игры очень много споров... многие считают, что эта игра не стоит потраченного времени и денег! НО! Если ты даже не пробовал поиграть в эту игру, то ты упустил шанс познакомиться с шедевром игровой индустрии!!! Почему я так считаю? (Это лично моё мнение) Потому что игра захватывает своим таинственным и запутанным сюжетом, ты сопереживаешь с героями все невзгоды! Эта игра заставляет о чём-то задуматься! Играешь в неё и, есть чувство как будто смотришь интригующий фильм или читаешь интересную книгу! 
Отличная графика! Отличный геймплей! Красивый город! И отличный сюжет! Советую всем!!!

AMAZING GAMEEE, beautifull,excellent plot,excellent world and excellent Elizabeth! This isnt just an average FPS this is an FPS which doesnt just focus mainly on the action, but it also focuses on the amazing plot and the brilliant world. Trust me,ones you step into  Columbia your eyes will EXPLODe. And also for ones you are with an NPC in the entire game which is not annoying, Elizabeth never gets in your way and is always there to help, it is amazing how the developers where able to make a brand new world with there own religion,policies and even people well of course the elder scrolls has made a world with more variety but we are focusing on Bioshock, and they aslo know how to make beuatiful worlds scary or not. Many of you who will play this game will probalby not understand the concepts of this game but nevertheless you will still like the game.

This, to me, was probably the most disappointing game I played this year. Nearly all of my friends and other people I spoke to who had played this game enjoyed it and the game was critically reviewed well, so I may be a bit alone here. I thought this game took a pretty big step backward in overall game design and pacing compared to the previous Bioshocks. There were large chunks of this game where I did nothing but shoot enemies, then there were large chunks where the game decided it wanted to tell a story for a while and just guided me around Columbia. But the chunks weren’t mixed in throughout the game. They were just…chunks. It also took out the excellent level design that I loved from the first two games where upon entering a new area, you had to be aware of your surroundings and the enemies you were fighting and use the appropriate plasmids to lay traps and what not. Infinite mostly just had large open areas filled with enemies that you had to kill with… whatever. Again and again and again. 

I didn’t think Columbia had the charm, atmosphere and polish that Rapture did so well in the earlier games either. I also experienced some balancing issues with this game. I pretty much had my character maxed out in everything about halfway into the game and was mowing down anything in my way without much thought or effort. 

There’s so much more this game could have done with mixing up gameplay/artwork/music with their parallel dimensions theme too. A lot of lost potential. To its credit, the ending of this game was pretty cool though.

For more game reviews, check out http://whatisjamesplaying.blogspot.com/
Possably the greatest game and game series of this generation.... Its a must buy

This is the first game I have played in a long time that visually blew me away. Right after the intro when you first see Columbia, it is glorious. I actually walked around looking at the buildings and signs for awhile. Props to the visual artists on this game. The combat on hard difficulty was well balanced. It certainly required some skill and thinking on how to engage a given fight. It took roughly 15 hours of playtime to complete. Weapon selection and approach to combat can be great diversified depending on the gear you wear and items you choose to upgrade. 

Fantastic game. 100% recommended.

Absolutely exceptional. The story is one of the best that I have seen, and it adds some new and interesting gameplay elements while still remaining true to the original combat system in Bioshock 1 and 2.

It's a great game, truly. Elizabeth comes out as a great companion to have along. The world of Columbia is no less amazing than Raupture. The storytelling is quite reminiscent of the previous Bioshocks, and it comes off marvelously in the end. 
Only problem is the actual gameplay. It feels too Call-of-Duty-like. I would rather like it if they stuck to the original formula in that term, but otherwise it is great. Definitely a must-have.

The first few hours of Bioshock infinite are breathtaking! Taking in all the beautiful sights of Zepplins, fair "gowers" and the normal city folk in the sky. Being a lover of the Bioshock series, I couldn't wait to get my hands on the game, although the begining graphically is incredible, and state of the art the gameplay ceased to exist. The game picks up steadily as you continue, and the introduction to the beautiful graphic work tones down slighty. I highly recommend the game, and upon finishing you will be asking for more!

- Corey

One of the best interactive movies I've ever experienced. Truly a great cinematic experience. Oh wait, this is supposed to be a video game. If you're buying BioShock Infinite for the gameplay experience then you'll be dissapointed. It's a very generic arcady shooter with enemies that don't get smarter or more interesting, but rather just turn into thicker bullet sponges with slightly stronger weapons. The AI is terrible, most of the weapons and vigors are horribly underwhelming or otherwise useless and the game just fails so hard at trying to be an RPG in addition to a shooter.

Still though, despite it's ridiculous amount of blatant plot holes it actually manages to have a decent story, albeit one that hides behind a thin veil of false complexity by simply trying to confuse the player as much as possible up until the end with it's alternate universe nonsense. BioShock Infinite is by no means a bad game but it's difficult to actually admit that it's one of the best games we've seen in the past few years because it's moderate mediocrity just proves how terrible most video games nowadays are.

Don't want to spoil anything but don't forget to........ sorry nearly let the bird out of the bag. Anyway a great game with lots to keep even the best players going especially in the unlockable 1999 mode. Keep an eye out for hidden rooms, check all corners and roofs, using skyhooks. As far as Bioshock goes this is the best of the lot, great DLC's as well. Buy and enjoy!

Сложно обойтись без спойлеров, но постараюсь. Первая половина игры реально напоминала аттракцион. В хорошем смысле этого слова: замечал за собой, что постоянно вжимаюсь в диван - как будто я на американских горках, а не перед монитором. И дело не в "покатушках" по рельсам - они как раз больше раздражали, чем радовали. Происходящее на экране первые 6-8 часов действительно захватывает.

После середины игры сценаристы стали вплетать приёмы, с помощью которых можно было бы объяснить вообще всё что угодно. Это нечестно, так как убивает на корню любую интригу - как ни выстраивай сюжет, всё равно выход есть и очевидно каким он будет. Неудивительно, что в Голливуде зарубили экранизацию - в сущности, кроме действительно интересной альтернативной вселенной, у BioShock Infinite ничего нет.

Как FPS игра откровенно посредственная: типов врагов мало - берут количеством, поездки по рельсам в процессе битвы добавляют мельтешения и ощущения аттракциона, но по сути только отвлекают. Именно по этим причинам вторая половина Infinite прошла для меня достаточно скучно, несмотря на все виды (а виды тут шикарные).

Но именно из-за первой половины игры её и можно порекомендовать. Особенно тем, кто играет мало или не играет вообще - просто посмотреть какими могут быть современные игры. Не на примере боевиков или специфических MMORPG, а на примере игры, которая во многих смыслах является интерактивным фильмом.

最重要的是，Elizabeth的ㄋㄟㄋㄟ讚！

One of the best storylines I've seen since Bioshock 1 and 2. This is a MUST PLAY and there are no reasons why you shouldn't play this game! If you haven't even started yet, you're missing out of everything. You don't have to worry about playing Bioshock 1 and 2 since Bioshock Infinite's storyline is seperate from the series, somewhat
A corridor in the sky. Story seemed to be pretty much the same as the first bioshock.

This game is breathtaking. Its interesting story fused with its addictive and fun gameplay make an outstanding combination. This time around there are only 8 vigors(plasmids)to choose from, while this might seem like a bad thing at first, the vigors have a very wide variety and you dont have to go buy extra slots to store them like in the first ones. The scenery is beautiful. Even in the most intense battles the city of Columbia always hasa a new sight to engross and enthrall you. The characters are also fun to listen to and learn about and will make you want to collect every Voxophone to listen to different points of view and stories. The only thing I was kind of dissapointed in was a lack of multiplayer. This is not a short game in the least, but the game is so amazing that it seems to go by very fast, and I wanted to use my upgraded weapons and vigors more than the time encompassed. All in all, this game is definately worth buying. You wont regret it

100% recomendable. Hablar de Bioshocks siempre es sinonimo de calidad. Pero lo grandioso y magestuoso que encontré en este juego aún me deja sin palabras. Uno de los mejores juegos que jugué ultimamente. A nivel gráfico y artistico, es impecable. Todo el entorno y universo que crearon es de otra galaxia. Ni hablar de los personajes y las relaciones entre ellos. La banda sonora es excelente. Y qué decir de la historia, es simplemente EPICA. El final me dejó totalmente sin palabras.
Sin dudas es uno de los grandes juegos del 2013, y una compra obligatoria, aunque no te gusten los juegos en primera persona. Para disfrutar una, y varias veces más.

This is a great game with stunning visuals and a story that will stick with you for a while. 

Pros
- Amazing story with memorable characters and an NPC companion that's actually useful
- Fun "magic" system that adds a lot of different tactics to the standard gunplay
- Stunning visuals and amazing environments
- Easy controls and a well-adjusted difficulty scale that allows an easy playthrough for those more interested in story or a challenging game for FPS vets.
- Good integration of story and gameplay
- Very immersive world that really draws you in and quickly turns against you when you learn Columbia's dark secret
- Ending that will stay with you

Cons
- FPS elements are fairly standard
- Gameplay can be repetative as far as combat goes (though you rarely notice it thanks to immersion)
- Story can be confusing at times, sometimes you will have to play through again or look things up to understand what's going on

This is one of those rare tripple A games that gets it right.  And even though the main gameplay is mostly shooter based with minor RPG elements, the story of Columbia and Booker will grab hold of you to the point where you just want to keep going to find out what will happen.  The immersion in this game is truly spectacular and has an ending that will stay with you.  Even at full price I would recommend this game, it's one of the greats of 2013!
If The Last of Us didn't exist, this would be my Game of The Year.

Earlier this year, I've told everyone that Tomb Raider was my favorite game of 2013. Well, in the theme of constants and variables, it was | had been. 
Bioshock Infinite is the type of game that you live through rather than play through. It's the experience. You could go even farther, and say that it's an average shooter with little strategy involved (compared to the firs Bioshock for example), and no survival urgency. All that doesn't hurt the title much because the story is THAT good. I'm not exaggerating by calling it one of the best games I've ever played, comparing the thrills and gut wrenching to the likes of the Metal Gear Solid and chosen Final Fantasy games. It has a very smart plot and makes you want to play the game a second time through with even more attention to EVERY SINGLE WORD or IMAGE you perceive. Add to this the brilliant voice acting duo of Troy Baker And Courtnee Draper Cover, and amazing art design of Columbia, and you have yourself a winner. 
There are different types of gamers that demand different things out of games. I must imagine that a lot of people didn't have the patience for a game with a long narrative introduction, and parts of it happening for example on a sunny carefree beach with music and people dancing. But those that got caught up in the magic never regretted it.
The Bioshock series shows us humanity at it's best and worst, sometimes even in the same single character. It gives us hope, being cynical at the same time. But most of all, it makes us think about the grey areas of life... And death.
I'm not a fan of the slow and clunky combat model, but overall, this game is worth the buy. The story keeps you in it until the end if you're not put off by the mysticism of it all.

This game is a masterpiece. The story is very well done, the visuals, environment and overrall gameplay. I hope to get the burial at sea dlcs soon.

Bloody amazing game; The visuals are still top, the characters are all interesting and not two-dimensional, and the gameplay is still a fun as it was in previous games. It is a little bothersome with the whole only 2 weapon slots meaning you only really specialize into two guns that you choose early on and hold on to the whole game. But, the best part was most definitely the ending. It still sticks with me and I beat it almost two weeks ago. I also love how it doesn't feel like an escort quest due to Elizabeth's actual helpfulness and enjoyable character. She seems more like an actual person than just a wailing, troublesome lump of flesh that gets in your line of fire and whines about it. I like seeing how she develops from this innocent, fresh-faced girl to a more hardened woman as she progresses through the game and faces the realities of the world around her. 9.3/10 for annoying ending final fight holdout area and restraint of gun slots.

Bioshock Infinite has one of the strongest and most imaginative stories I've come across. The characters are all easy to empathise AND hate, a product of truly gifted writing.
As for the general feel of the game, there were points when the smoothness of movement could have been better when switching weapons/casting vigours, but this was swiftly looked past as the aesthetics of the game outshine any small imperfections.
Thanks to the steam sale I got to play this game over the Christmas period, but if you ask me, it is well worth the full price.
In short - bloody marvellous. I look forward to playing every second of the downloadable content, and achieving 100%.
